data.current_description:
Returns information about block with transactions, subject to paging.

Note: Blockbook always follows the main chain of the backend it is attached to. If there is a rollback-reorg in the backend, Blockbook will also do rollback. When you ask for block by height, you will always get the main chain block. If you ask for block by hash, you may get the block from another fork but it is not guaranteed (backend may not keep it)
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve block details with transactions and pagination
data.description_suggestion: Returns detailed information about a specific block including its transactions, subject to pagination. Accepts block identifier as either block hash or block height. When querying by height, returns the main chain block. When querying by hash, may return blocks from alternative forks depending on backend availability. Note: Blockbook follows the main chain; rollbacks in the backend trigger corresponding rollbacks in Blockbook. Returns paginated transaction list within the block.

message: Operation 'getAddressV2' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Original summary 'Get address V2' is generic and doesn't convey the operation's flexibility. data.current_description:
Returns balances and transactions of an address. The returned transactions are sorted by block height, newest blocks first.

The **details** query parameter can specify the level of details returned by the request (default: "txids").
Possible values are:

**basic**: return only xpub balances, without any derived addresses and transactions

**tokens**: basic + tokens (addresses) derived from the xpub, subject to tokens parameter

**tokenBalances**: basic + tokens (addresses) derived from the xpub with balances, subject to tokens parameter

**txids**: tokenBalances + list of txids, subject to from, to filter and paging

**txs**: tokenBalances + list of transaction with details, subject to from, to filter and paging
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve address balances and transactions with configurable detail levels
data.description_suggestion: Returns balances and transaction history for a specified address. Transactions are sorted by block height (newest first). The **details** parameter controls the response granularity: **basic** (xpub balances only), **tokens** (derived token addresses), **tokenBalances** (token addresses with balances), **txids** (token balances + transaction IDs with from/to filtering and paging), or **txs** (token balances + full transaction details with filtering and paging). Default is "txids". Supports pagination via from/to parameters and token filtering.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get address V2' is generic and doesn't convey the operation's flexibility. data.current_description:
Returns balances and transactions of an xpub or output descriptor, applicable only for Bitcoin-type coins.

Blockbook supports BIP44, BIP49, BIP84 and BIP86 (Taproot) derivation schemes, using either xpubs or output descriptors (see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/descriptors.md)

Note: usedTokens always returns total number of used addresses of xpub.

Detailed documentation found here: https://github.com/trezor/blockbook/blob/master/docs/api.md#get-xpub
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve xpub balances and transaction history
data.description_suggestion: Returns balances, transactions, and address usage statistics for an xpub or output descriptor on Bitcoin-type blockchains. Supports BIP44, BIP49, BIP84, and BIP86 (Taproot) derivation schemes. The response includes the total number of used addresses (usedTokens field) and transaction details. Applicable only for Bitcoin-type coins.

data.current_description:
Returns array of unspent transaction outputs of address or xpub, applicable only for Bitcoin-type coins. By default, the list contains both confirmed and unconfirmed transactions. The query parameter confirmed=true disables return of unconfirmed transactions. The returned utxos are sorted by block height, newest blocks first. For xpubs or output descriptors, the response also contains address and derivation path of the utxo.



Unconfirmed utxos do not have field height, the field confirmations has value 0 and may contain field lockTime, if not zero.

Coinbase utxos have field coinbase set to true, however due to performance reasons only up to minimum coinbase confirmations limit (100). After this limit, utxos are not detected as coinbase.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve unspent transaction outputs for address or xpub
data.description_suggestion: Returns an array of unspent transaction outputs (UTXOs) for a specified address or xpub on Bitcoin-type blockchains. By default includes both confirmed and unconfirmed transactions; use the confirmed=true parameter to return only confirmed UTXOs. Results are sorted by block height (newest first). For xpubs or output descriptors, includes address and derivation path for each UTXO. Unconfirmed UTXOs lack the height field and have confirmations=0. Coinbase UTXOs are flagged up to 100 confirmations; beyond this limit, coinbase status is not detected.

data.current_description:
Returns information about block with transactions, subject to paging.

Note: Blockbook always follows the main chain of the backend it is attached to. If there is a rollback-reorg in the backend, Blockbook will also do rollback. When you ask for block by height, you will always get the main chain block. If you ask for block by hash, you may get the block from another fork but it is not guaranteed (backend may not keep it)
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve block details with transactions and pagination
data.description_suggestion: Returns detailed information about a specific block including its transactions, subject to pagination. Accepts block identifier as either block hash or block height. When querying by height, returns the main chain block. When querying by hash, may return blocks from alternative forks depending on backend availability. Note: Blockbook follows the main chain; rollbacks in the backend trigger corresponding rollbacks in Blockbook. Returns paginated transaction list within the block.

message: Operation 'getAddressV2' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Original summary 'Get address V2' is generic and doesn't convey the operation's full capability. data.current_description:
Returns balances and transactions of an address. The returned transactions are sorted by block height, newest blocks first.

The **details** query parameter can specify the level of details returned by the request (default: "txids").
Possible values are:

**basic**: return only xpub balances, without any derived addresses and transactions

**tokens**: basic + tokens (addresses) derived from the xpub, subject to tokens parameter

**tokenBalances**: basic + tokens (addresses) derived from the xpub with balances, subject to tokens parameter

**txids**: tokenBalances + list of txids, subject to from, to filter and paging

**txs**: tokenBalances + list of transaction with details, subject to from, to filter and paging
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve address balances, transactions, and token information
data.description_suggestion: Returns balances, transactions, and optional token information for a specified address. Transactions are sorted by block height (newest first). The **details** parameter controls response granularity: **basic** (xpub balances only), **tokens** (derived addresses), **tokenBalances** (with balances), **txids** (transaction IDs with paging), or **txs** (full transaction details with paging). Default is **txids**. Supports filtering by block range (from/to parameters) and pagination. For extended public keys (xpub), returns derived address information based on the details level specified.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get address V2' is generic and doesn't convey the operation's full capability. While the description includes the details parameter options, it could better explain the hierarchical nature of the details levels and how they relate to each other. data.current_description:
Returns balances and transactions of an xpub or output descriptor, applicable only for Bitcoin-type coins.

Blockbook supports BIP44, BIP49, BIP84 and BIP86 (Taproot) derivation schemes, using either xpubs or output descriptors (see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/descriptors.md)

Note: usedTokens always returns total number of used addresses of xpub.

Detailed documentation found here: https://github.com/trezor/blockbook/blob/master/docs/api.md#get-xpub
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve xpub balances and transaction history
data.description_suggestion: Returns balances, transactions, and address usage statistics for an xpub or output descriptor on Bitcoin-type blockchains. Supports BIP44, BIP49, BIP84, and BIP86 (Taproot) derivation schemes. The response includes the total number of used addresses (usedTokens field) and transaction details. Applicable only for Bitcoin-type coins.

data.current_description:
Returns array of unspent transaction outputs of address or xpub, applicable only for Bitcoin-type coins. By default, the list contains both confirmed and unconfirmed transactions. The query parameter confirmed=true disables return of unconfirmed transactions. The returned utxos are sorted by block height, newest blocks first. For xpubs or output descriptors, the response also contains address and derivation path of the utxo.



Unconfirmed utxos do not have field height, the field confirmations has value 0 and may contain field lockTime, if not zero.

Coinbase utxos have field coinbase set to true, however due to performance reasons only up to minimum coinbase confirmations limit (100). After this limit, utxos are not detected as coinbase.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve unspent transaction outputs for address or xpub
data.description_suggestion: Returns an array of unspent transaction outputs (UTXOs) for a specified address or xpub on Bitcoin-type blockchains. By default includes both confirmed and unconfirmed transactions; use the confirmed=true parameter to return only confirmed UTXOs. Results are sorted by block height (newest first). For xpubs or output descriptors, includes address and derivation path for each UTXO. Unconfirmed UTXOs lack the height field and have confirmations=0. Coinbase UTXOs are flagged up to 100 confirmations; beyond this limit, coinbase status is not detected.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get UTXO V2' lacks action clarity. Description is detailed but could better emphasize the confirmed parameter as a key input option for AI agents. data.current_description: Get basic summary of info relating to the currently selected blockchain
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve blockchain status and summary information
data.description_suggestion: Returns basic summary information about the specified blockchain, including network statistics, current block height, and chain status. This operation provides an overview of the blockchain's current state and is useful for verifying connectivity and obtaining baseline blockchain metrics.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Blockchain Info Summary' is vague and not action-oriented. Description lacks specificity about what information is returned. message: Operation 'getBlockV2' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Get Block V2' is generic and lacks action clarity. Description contains important operational context but doesn't clearly specify input parameters (hash vs height) or output structure. Improved version clarifies the dual input modes, explains the behavioral differences, maintains the important fork/rollback context, and specifies pagination support for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
Returns information about block with transactions, subject to paging.

Note: Blockbook always follows the main chain of the backend it is attached to. If there is a rollback-reorg in the backend, Blockbook will also do rollback. When you ask for block by height, you will always get the main chain block. If you ask for block by hash, you may get the block from another fork but it is not guaranteed (backend may not keep it)
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve block details with transactions and pagination
data.description_suggestion: Returns detailed information about a specific block including its transactions, subject to pagination. Accepts block identifier as either block hash or block height. When querying by height, returns the main chain block. When querying by hash, may return blocks from alternative forks depending on backend availability. Note: Blockbook follows the main chain; rollbacks in the backend trigger corresponding rollbacks in Blockbook. Returns paginated transaction list within the block.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get Block V2' is generic and lacks action clarity. Description contains important operational context but doesn't clearly specify input parameters (hash vs height) or output structure. Improved version clarifies the dual input modes, explains the behavioral differences, maintains the important fork/rollback context, and specifies pagination support for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'getBlockHashV2' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary lacks action clarity ('Get block hash' vs 'Retrieve block hash'). Description is minimal and doesn't explain the return value or use case. Improved version clarifies the action, specifies that it returns the hash (not just describes the operation), emphasizes main chain behavior, and provides context about typical use cases for AI agents.

data.current_description:
Get block hash by its height

Note: Blockbook always follows the main chain of the backend it is attached to.

data.current_description:
Returns balances and transactions of an address. The returned transactions are sorted by block height, newest blocks first.

The **details** query parameter can specify the level of details returned by the request (default: "txids").
Possible values are:

**basic**: return only xpub balances, without any derived addresses and transactions

**tokens**: basic + tokens (addresses) derived from the xpub, subject to tokens parameter

**tokenBalances**: basic + tokens (addresses) derived from the xpub with balances, subject to tokens parameter

**txids**: tokenBalances + list of txids, subject to from, to filter and paging

**txs**: tokenBalances + list of transaction with details, subject to from, to filter and paging
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve address balances and transactions with configurable detail levels
data.description_suggestion: Returns balances and transaction history for a specified address. Transactions are sorted by block height (newest first). The **details** parameter controls the response granularity: **basic** (xpub balances only), **tokens** (derived token addresses), **tokenBalances** (token addresses with balances), **txids** (token balances + transaction IDs with from/to filtering and paging), or **txs** (token balances + full transaction details with filtering and paging). Default is "txids". Supports pagination via from/to parameters and token filtering.

data.current_description:
Returns balances and transactions of an xpub or output descriptor, applicable only for Bitcoin-type coins.

Blockbook supports BIP44, BIP49, BIP84 and BIP86 (Taproot) derivation schemes, using either xpubs or output descriptors (see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/descriptors.md)

Note: usedTokens always returns total number of used addresses of xpub.

Detailed documentation found here: https://github.com/trezor/blockbook/blob/master/docs/api.md#get-xpub
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve xpub balances and transaction history
data.description_suggestion: Returns balances, transactions, and address usage statistics for an xpub or output descriptor on Bitcoin-type blockchains. Supports BIP44, BIP49, BIP84, and BIP86 (Taproot) derivation schemes. The response includes the total number of used addresses (usedTokens field) and transaction details. Applicable only for Bitcoin-type coins.

data.current_description:
Returns array of unspent transaction outputs of address or xpub, applicable only for Bitcoin-type coins. By default, the list contains both confirmed and unconfirmed transactions. The query parameter confirmed=true disables return of unconfirmed transactions. The returned utxos are sorted by block height, newest blocks first. For xpubs or output descriptors, the response also contains address and derivation path of the utxo.



Unconfirmed utxos do not have field height, the field confirmations has value 0 and may contain field lockTime, if not zero.

Coinbase utxos have field coinbase set to true, however due to performance reasons only up to minimum coinbase confirmations limit (100). After this limit, utxos are not detected as coinbase.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve unspent transaction outputs for address or xpub
data.description_suggestion: Returns an array of unspent transaction outputs (UTXOs) for a specified address or xpub on Bitcoin-type blockchains. By default includes both confirmed and unconfirmed transactions; use the confirmed=true parameter to return only confirmed UTXOs. Results are sorted by block height (newest first). For xpubs or output descriptors, includes address and derivation path for each UTXO. Unconfirmed UTXOs lack the height field and have confirmations=0. Coinbase UTXOs are flagged up to 100 confirmations; beyond this limit, coinbase status is not detected.
